critique: This document is an executive order that returns land within the Tongass National Forest in Alaska to the public domain. It appears to be for the purpose of allowing people to establish homesites or fish canneries. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration policy, executive power expansion, or impacts on national security vs. civil liberties. It seems to favor local control over federal, and potentially deregulation by allowing private use of land. There's no clear impact on social inclusion.
